141311.content:
As you make your way slowly out of the kitchen and into the hallway, you're made much more aware of your size. Although you spent a little time moving around the kitchen and tidying, that was little more than short sharp bursts. Now that you're moving somewhere with a purpose, you can feel how slow and deliberate each step is, how your body gently rocks from side to side as you move and how your body – mostly your big, round belly – shakes and jiggles each time your foot hits the ground. Passing through the door frame you feel the need to clamp your arms into your sides, where they sink into your love handles, belly and chest fat, and wrap them underneath your belly at the bottom, to ensure that you pass through without incident. You pass through more easily than you would have expected, but the shaking and wobbling feels more pronounced now as your fat quivers against and over your arms. You have no idea what Garrett can or can't see as he's following behind you, you're just glad that you can't see his facial expressions and that he's kept any smart comments to himself.

Rounding the corner into the hallway you begin to relax a little, until you catch sight of the mirror. Even at an angle you can instantly see that it isn't reflecting the stairway, wall hangings and side table with photo frames on it, but instead it seems to be showing someplace completely different. The image seems to be a little hazy but you can just make out some fuzzy bookshelves and what appears to be a desk or table with some bottles on it. As you move around to face it head on, you notice that the image doesn't change perspective with the differing angle. It's like some kind of arcane video conference - the only thing missing is Felix. "Hey, move up." You turn your head to take a look at Garrett and realise that you're taking up most of the space in front of the mirror, so you awkwardly shuffle slowly to the side to let him get a better look. You find yourself idly thinking about how small the hallway feels, before quickly realising the fault in your logic. Will everywhere feel much smaller and more enclosed now? Before you can finish the thought Felix slowly appears in the mirror as if from nowhere.

"Whoa!" Your brother says, shrinking back slightly before quickly gathering his composure. "So he's real then..." You glance over at Garrett and frown.

"I thought you said that believed me?"

"I believed that you believed it." Garret replies nonchalantly. "Me, I thought that you were going to need sectioning as well as some SlimFast."

"Hello, ah..." Felix interrupts, looking between the two of you. "You'll have to excuse me, but I'm having some trouble telling the two of you apart." You and Garrett exchange disbelieving looks before looking back at Felix.

"Do you really not recognise me?" you say.

"Maybe the guy that looks like he hit the all-you-can-eat buffet, finished off all the food and then inhaled the furniture for dessert is the one that you gave your little magic toys to." Garrett says, his voice thick with sarcasm.

"That's my brother Garrett. You can tell us apart because he's the one with the smart mouth and wears t-shirts that are so tight that they're meant to hug his non-existent muscles." Garrett begins to scowl, but it quickly turns into a sickening smile.

"Ha! You don't get to use the too tight clothes line anymore, butterball," he says, giving you a couple of soft punches in the side of the belly. "Your t-shirt has turned into a crop top."

"I see what you mean about his smart mouth." Felix says drily. "I'm sorry, I find it difficult to tell huma... I mean, people apart sometimes. But now that I look again," he continues, squinting between the two of you, "I suppose that you are a little larger." You don't know if you're going to see Felix again after today, but if you do you don't think you'll ever get used to his – eccentricities. "Well, it was very nice to meet your brother and I'm glad that you're putting the clay to good use, but I have a lot of work to be..."

"But that's just it, I haven't used the clay."

"Oh." Felix says, drawing the word out. "I see." He takes an uncomfortably long time to stare at you, before seeming to catch himself with a start and look away. "Do you have the gem and the clay with you now?"

"Yes, I have one in each of my pockets."

"How long have they been in there?"

"I put them there just after we said goodbye. I haven't touched them since."

"Hmm..." Felix says, dragging the word out again. "Then you truly haven't used them. The clay you use by tearing a chunk off and consuming it, whilst imagining the change you wish – it will grow back soon after. The gem you merely need to hold and concentrate on the musculature that you desire, just in case you were curious." Although his tone doesn't change, you understand Felix's point and feel pretty embarrassed. "Now, tell me exactly what has happened since we parted ways."

Your explanation to Felix is much briefer and to the point than the one you gave Garrett, focussing exclusively upon your voracious hunger, lack of any discernable stomach capacity limit and inability to feel full despite eating huge amounts of food. Felix listens intently, nodding at various points as you speak. After you finish, he remains silent for a time, stroking his chin slowly in deep reflection.

"So... do you have any idea what might be happening to him?" Garrett is the first to speak up.

"There are several possible explanations." Felix says eventually, sighing. "The answer may lie in the field of magical psychology, which is not my area of expertise – your subconscious may be responsible for your weight gain. Or you may be magically sensitive and using the clay in a manner that most ordinary people would not be able to and without meaning to. Alternatively, some outside force may be responsible for your condition, using the clay as some kind of... conduit. They would need to be powerful but it is possible."

"What's our next step?" You ask, a little anxiously. Although you've always wanted to be bigger, the idea of having no control over your growth is a little scary.

"I will need to consult some colleagues and do a little research. It really is quite fascinating, had I had you under lab conditions since the beginning, then I could have made some really important discoveries." Perhaps sensing your discomfort, Felix moves on. "I will place a magical barrier around your subconscious to stop it from interfering and interacting with any form of magic. However if food is the trigger and not your mind, then you should keep away from all forms of food, no matter how big or small, otherwise it may trigger another... bout. You may be fine being close to it, but do not eat or drink until I say otherwise."

"What if I keep gaining weight anyway?"

"Then we will narrow down our options." Felix says very matter of factly. "If you want to do something while you wait, then take this." Felix waves his hand and you feel an object appear in your hand. Raising your arm, you see what appears to be a wand in your hand, although at the base it splits into two distinct prongs that splay apart, making a v-shape. "In layman's terms, this is a magical dowsing rod. It can be used to divine the location of a source of magic that is affecting the user. If the reason for your expansion is external to you, then this well help you to find the cause."

"Wait a minute," says Garrett, "wouldn't that involve leaving the house? I mean it doesn't exactly look like he's at a good size for investigative work and wouldn't that potentially bring him into contact with food?"

"Your brother is perfectly healthy. His mobility may be a little compromised by his size, but much like with the clay his overall physical fitness should be much the same as it was previously. Speaking of the clay," Felix goes on to say, turning his attention back to you, "I would recommend against using the clay or the gem until we know more. They may have unexpected consequences when interacting with whatever you are being affected by."

"I understand."

"As soon as I find something out, I will let you know." You go to say something, but suddenly the image fades and you're left looking in the mirror at a man that looks much like you, but with a prominently round belly and a t-shirt that stops several inches short of his belly button.

"What a day." Garrett says, shaking his head slowly. "So what are you going to do?"

"I don't have many options. Either I hide away in my room and away from food or use the rod to see what I can find out."

"Or you could come to work with me. I could keep an eye on you there and you could make a bit of money."

"But isn't there food there? Some of the stock handled there is food, isn't it? I'm not sure if the money is worth... Oh, I get it..." you say, suddenly aware of why Garrett suggested it. "You want to make sure I have enough money to replace your food."

"OK, you got me." Garrett says with a grin. "But you're not that much safer here. You know mom is constantly cooking something or other and we're going to have to replace the food you ate. Plus the 'wizard made me fat' line worked on me, I don't think it's going to fly with her. I genuinely can keep an eye on you at work."

Garrett makes a good point, but using the dowsing wand could bring you closer to finding out the truth and keep you busy. What if you suddenly started getting fatter at Garrett's job? But then what if you suddenly started to blow up while you wandered around using the wand. Holing up at home seemed like the least pro-active thing to do and even that had its fair share of risk. As fat as you are, you couldn't be sure that your mother wouldn't try and palm off some more food onto you. None of the options seemed particularly safe.

You head up to your room, taking the stairs slowly and noting the low creaking sound that they make despite your attempts at treading on them as softly as you can with each laboured step. As you hold it out in front of you and slowly turn around, you can feel a gentle tugging as you turn toward the centre of the city. You idly wonder if the answer to your randomly increasing size can be found out there and think of your newly fattened body and the pull becomes stronger; it is as if rather than guiding you the wand has magnetised your body and you feel the almost irresistible urge to find the source. You panic, your mind starts to race, trip over itself and lose focus, and the compulsion quickly begins to fade. You take a moment to centre yourself before starting to experiment some more. You think about things differently, focussing on your hunger pangs and feeding frenzies rather than your size and although the dowsing wand still pulls you in the same direction, you can feel it 'reset' before it does so. When you angle the wand downward rather than straight ahead, you notice the pull is much more subtle. You can hear him unpacking and putting things away downstairs and after a while you hear a knock at the door. "I swung by the big and tall store on the way back. You eventually get it up and over your head, but not without a lot of effort and the sounds of a few seams ripping. Inside the bag is a blue polo shirt that slips on and over your head pretty easily. You have to be a little careful putting your arms through the holes but it fits fairly well, although it is a little snug around the widest point of your belly. Your shoulders and arms look much thicker than before, perhaps partly because the sleeve of the polo shirt stopping an inch or two down from your armpit really emphasises the size of your upper arms. Whilst you know it's all fat it does give you a big, bulky, substantial look that is replicated by your bigger softer chest. The main attraction though is, of course, your gut. However well fitted the polo shirt may be, there's no hiding or flattering it – it is your dominant physical feature, a large, round, unaviodable mass not helped by your skin tight jeans forced down and sitting right underneath it, causing both your belly and love handles to cascade over the sides of the denim waistband.

Also in the bag are a pair of khaki cargo pants, the label of which stresses words like, "EXTRA DURABLE!" and, "STRETCHY!" They look to be a good size but putting them on would involve removing your jeans, which also prove to be incredibly durable but with a severely limited ability to stretch. You manage to get your fingers down to the button under your belly, but unfastening it proves to be impossible. Between your gut, wider hips and fatter thighs, the button is pushed right up against the edge of the hole that it is fastened through and no amount of forcing it or trying to suck your gut in helps to make it budge at all. You try and find a point along the waistband where there may be some give, but you come up with nothing. Felix warned you against using the clay and the gem given what's happening to you, but that isn't even a consideration; even your pockets are stretched out and impossible to push your fingers into. A short while later, Garrett knocks on your door again. "How are things going in there?"

"The shirt fits great, but the cargo pants are a bit baggy so I'm going to stick with my jeans," you lie, after you let him in. Garrett looks you up and down, but he doesn't say anything.

"Are you going to head out then? If you are, mom's back so you're going to have to be careful to avoid her. Want me to distract her? I can probably keep her busy in the kitchen."

"Any chance you can get her into the garden?" you ask. "On my way up the stairs, I... let's just say that my days of sneaking around are over."

"Yeah, well just remember that when you're lumbering around out there playing Miss Marple." Garrett says folding his arms. "Sure, I can probably do that. Wait at the top of the stairs and when you hear the back door slam, that's your cue."

"Thanks Garrett."

"No problem. I'll send you an invoice for those clothes. Figure I deserve a finders fee for locating that much fabric."

Garrett makes his way downstairs and you wait at the top, dowsing wand in hand. You can hear the muffled voices of your mother and Garrett in the kitchen, until they gradually become fainter and then disappear. A moment later, the back door slams shut and you make your way downstairs as quickly as you feel safe to. You go out the front door and much to your relief, you realise that the sun has almost fully set. Between your huge weight gain and the strange yellow glow of the cities lamplight, you're fairly confident that anyone who knows you wouldn't find it easy to recognise you. The dowsing rod still points you deeper into the heart of the city, so you slowly set off.

You don't need to worry much about being recognised. You don't know for a fact, but you suspect that your size encourages people to give you a wide berth, with some preferring to cross or walk on the street rather than get too close to you. Some may steal quick glances at you and they may have a comment or two to make once you walk by, but they seem happy to scurry by and avoid your attention. 1421222.content:
You’ve never been anyone to do things by halves - why else, in your first try with the gem, did you wish for a 56 inch chest - bigger than most weightlifters? So, as you sit down to finish off the lasagna having swallowed the awful tasting clay, you think about doubling your weight with fat. You figure that, with all that muscle, you must have been pushing 250 pounds, so doubling will put you easily into the quarter ton range.


Ravenously digging into the lasagna, you notice that your body is already starting to grow. Where the muscle wish had expanded your chest, it is now distinctly your gut that is growing. Your dragon t-shirt had been greatly stretched across the chest, now it is getting stretched across your gut (a body part you didn’t have before!) and the dragon design is getting destroyed. Your pants are suddenly terribly tight, so you undo the waist and the growing weight of your belly forces the zipper down. Part of your brain wonders what you’re going to do about clothes - but the rest of your brain ignores it, being too busy savoring the lasagna and watching your body flesh out.

About a third of the way through the lasagna, there is a ripping sound, as the left side seam on your t-shirt gives way from the pressure of your expanding belly. A moment later, the seam over your right shoulder does the same, leaving you with a rag of shirt hanging from one shoulder, and an increasingly tortured ring of shirt material stretching around your right bicep. You don’t stop eating, as your hungry drives you to plow on through the full tray of lasagna. A few minutes later there is a gentler ripping noise from the right leg of your jeans, as its inseam starts to fail. It had been badly strained by the muscular 36 inch thighs you had grow with the gem, and now, with a thickening layer of fat being added, the sewing started to give way. As you eat, further ripping noises are heard, as first the other leg inseam and then the seam at the butt slowly give way to the growing rotundity tide of your fattening body.

You gorge your way through the rest of the pan of lasagna, growing steadily all the time, and at the end chug an entire two litre carton of milk. Feeling suddenly less hungry, you sit back and examine the changed in your body. Your once lean body, only recently a muscle-bound Greek God image, now is round and jovial, though evidence of the muscles hiding underneath shows in your monstrous upper arms and barrel sized thighs. A massive belly hangs out most of the way to your knees, and pushes at the table. It laps out to either side, giving you love handles that hang out over the remnants of your jeans that are still clinging to your butt.

You are suddenly very thirsty, and decide to go see if there’s any soda in the fridge. You push back on the chair, which groans in protest, and get to your feet. As you rise there is a further ripping sound as the tortured seams of your old jeans give way, and some of the tattered remnants fall off. You stand in the kitchen with your new layers of thick fat wobbling. A couple of pieces of t-shirt cloth hang from your thick shoulders and fattened arms, and the remains of a pair of a pair of Levi’s loose fit size 34s still cling to your calves. You experimentally flex a calf and are greeted by further ripping noises. You’re thankful for the muscle you added earlier - you got up much more easily than you’d expected.

The floor creaks beneath your feet as you rumble over to the fridge, and you wonder vaguely how much you weigh - you must be well over 500 pounds! In the fridge you find a full two litre of Pepsi, which you guzzle on the spot as you rummage for more food.

You suddenly remember that hanging in your bedroom is a huge tartan housecoat that your uncle Larry had sent you as a gag gift last Christmas - at least, you thought it was huge last Christmas, you hope it’s big enough now. Only one problem - your bedroom is upstairs!
You take a two litre of rootbeer, a loaf of bread and a 5 lb bag of apples out of the fridge. As you head down the front hallway, you wonder if you can get your vastly fattened body up the stairs to your room. This will really test all those brand new muscles, you think as you start up slowly up the stairs. The bottom stair flexes slightly as you step on it, and the next step groans under your weight. Amazingly, it seems that only balance is really a problem for going up the stairs - your new leg muscles must be even stronger than you thought. At the top of the stairs you head into your room and drop the food beside your easy chair. You tear off the remnants of your t-shirt, jeans and underwear, and dig in the closet for the housecoat. You put it on, noting that it barely meets across your gut. Wow, you think, I am enormous, as you drop your fat butt onto the easy chair which groans and settles under the sudden mammoth load. You hit the remote, to find that the comedy channel is showing a re-run of the Nutty Professor, and you’ve tuned in just as he inflates to enormous size. Looking from the screen down to your huge protruding gut and back, you wonder just how big you are, and whether this is permanent or what. Didn’t the wizard say you could call him if you had questions or wanted to change the effect?

“Felix, Mr. Wizard, can you hear me? I’ve got some questions...”

Suddenly, the phone rings. You clamber out of the easy chair - not as easy as you thought, your belly gets in the way - to grab it.

“This is Felix.”

“Hi. I have a few questions.”

“I’m sure you do.”

“Is this effect permanent?”

“Well, it is and it isn’t. I can reverse it, of course, and if you don’t eat enough to maintain the fat, or do enough exercise to maintain the muscle, they will slowly shrink, just like any fat or muscle.”

“Oh, so I’m always going to be this hungry?”

“If you want to stay fat you are. And you’d better start exercising to keep those muscles.”

“OK. How big am I?”


“Don’t you know? Oh, yes, I forgot, humans aren’t usually aware of themselves that way. Let me give you that awareness.”

“610 pounds!”

“Well, you put on a huge amount of muscle, then ate enough to add a lot of fat, then doubled the whole thing.”

“Is it safe? I mean, am I healthy? Will I drop dead from being this fat?”

“You’ll be as healthy as if you had never put on the weight. If you were unhealthy before, you’ll be unhealthy now, and vice versa.”

“Sweet. Umm, what am I going to do for clothes?”

“Find a Big and Fat guy shop?”

“But I have nothing to wear to get there!”

“OK, I’ll give you a break. I’ll plant a charm so that anything you currently own will change as your weight changes. But anything new you want to buy - you’re on your own.”

“Sweet, thank you, this is great!”

“Don’t mention it. I reward those who do me a good turn.”

“Umm, one more thing. How big can I get? I mean like, is there an upper limit?”

“How big do you want to get? The clay and the gem will keep you healthy at any size, but there are other problems with being big. Remember, you still have to fit through doors...”


The phone is suddenly dead. You look around the room and see that, yes, the pair of jeans lying on the floor beside the bed look a lot bigger than they used to. You amble over to your underwear drawer, your huge thighs rubbing gently, to find that your boxer briefs all look big enough to fit...even you. You’re suddenly hungry again, so you sit down again on the easy chair, which groans and sags beneath your weight. You gobble down the apples and bread, and guzzle the Pepsi while watching a bit more of the Nutty Professor. Even at his biggest, he’s not as big as you are now, you think. Pretty good for not even out of high school yet! What to do now that you’re a huge, strong fat guy, you wonder. Become a WWF wrestler? Or a powerlifter? Join a circus? Do those strong guy events, like they have on TV or at Scottish festivals? Model fat guy clothes? The world’s heaviest football player? There are lots of fat computer geeks, aren’t there? And engineers? And truckdrivers?

You come out of your daydream of being the world’s biggest strongman and truck driver to hear the doorbell ringing. As you try to hurry to put on some clothes, you find that your new layers of flab bounce enough to really slow you down. Moving slowly and deliberately, you pull on a pair of boxer briefs which hug your fattened rump like a glove. The jeans follow, and you are impressed to find that they’re big enough to fit across your belly, not just under it. A black t-shirt, blown up huge, follows. You go over to the window and yell, “Just a minute.”

Going downstairs proves to be trickier than going up - the balance is tougher, and you grab the banister a couple of times, hoping it won’t break. When you get to the front door you find that it’s:

14212221.content:
After your intense effort at hurrying your vastly fattened body down the stairs, you open the door to find your mother waiting there. “I’m sorry dear, I forgot my key.” She bustles in, her arms full of shopping bags, and you look out past her to see the minivan with its tailgate up. “There’s lots more groceries in the van - could you bring them in?” You head down the steps, balancing carefully so your new gut doesn’t pull you over, and as you stride out to the minivan, your vast gut bounces with every step. You find the back of the minivan is full of grocery bags. It looks like your mother has bought enough for at least a month! This is convenient, to say the least, as your appetite has grown so much.


As you pick up grocery bags, you find that you can balance them on and against your belly - using it like a shelf. You fill your arms and waddle back, to find her waiting at the door. You wobble a bit as you head up the steps, but you make it safely and she takes the groceries from you. You head down the steps again, and find the balancing much easier this time. As you stride out to the minivan again, you feel happy and confident and capable of almost anything, despite your vast size. You decide to go out for football, wrestling, weightlifting - all the big guy athletic stuff you weren’t big enough to do before. And if your new fat slows you down, then you’ll just add more muscle to help out - after all, Felix said you’d be healthy no matter what size you grew to, and that there was no limit, really.

With these happy thoughts in mind you sweep up a load of groceries and practically float back to the house. Well, you bounce, really, or at least your fat body does as you walk. You vault up the front stairs without trouble and carry the groceries into the kitchen. The floor in the kitchen creaks as you halt in front of the counter, and then it hits you - your mother hasn’t said anything about your gain? It’s as if she hasn’t noticed. As you help her put the groceries away, you note that she has bought all your favourites, and in big quantities - huge pan lasagnas, frozen pies, lots of potatoes and hamburgers, a big sack of apples, lots of chocolate chip cookies. She gets everything put away and then microwaves you a “snack” - a one pound frozen Shepherd’s Pie. You dig in - after all that effort, you are feeling peckish - then decide to head down the street to Brian’s place. Your mum tells you not to be late for supper, as she’s bought a chocolate cream pie for you.

As you walk out to the curb, your massive body bouncing, a little old lady drives by, a sneer of disapproval on her face. A couple of 13 year olds race by on their bikes, pointing at you and yelling, “Don’t crack the sidewalk, fatty!” As you arrive at Brian’s, you wonder how he will react to your newly enlarged size. You knock and he comes to the door.

“Hi, Rick, c’mon in,” he says. “Are you hungry? I’ve just downloaded a great new video game, you gotta try it.” He says nothing as you waddle through his front door, and the two of you head up the stairs to his room. Balancing on the stairs this time seems easy - you don’t grab the rail at all - but the stairs groan continuously under your weight. Brian hasn’t said anything about your weight either....

In Brian’s room, you drop onto a chair beside his desk - which creaks beneath you - and he offers you a jumbo bag of BBQ chips and a box of granola bars, taking a much smaller bag of cheezies for himself. He resets the game, and once the two of you have played for half an hour, he pulls out a rootbeer for both of you. Again, yours is much bigger than his - you get a two litre bottle, he gets a can. And still he hasn’t said anything about your massive gain. So, you ask him, “Don’t you notice anything different about me?”

“Well, you’ve put on a few pounds, but it looks good on you! And I knew you wanted to go out for football this fall, so I figured you’d be bulking up.”
A few pounds? When you’ve gained over 400 pounds? What’s going on? When Brian ducks out to the washroom, you ask out loud, “Felix, Mr. Wizard, what’s going on?” The phone rings, and you pick it up.

“You’ve discovered one of the side effects, have you?” asked Felix in his thin voice. “You never asked me about side-effects, you may remember.”

“No, I didn’t.”
“Well, you’ve discovered the first one: those closest to you, those you care about most notice your weight gain the least. Your mother hasn’t noticed it at all - Brian only thinks you’ve put on a few pounds. That little old lady saw all of your 600 pounds, though.”

“Are there any other side effects?”
“Well, it depends on the person. Most people find that, after a gain, they’re ravenously hungry until they’ve eaten as much weight of food as the gain they’ve had. But the clay tends to facilitate this too - that lasagna your mother cooked, and those huge snacks Brian is giving you, are not accidents.”
“Is that all?”

“It depends on the person. Watch and observe!” and the phone goes dead just as Brian stepped back into the room.

“Who was that?”
“Just my mum, reminding me about dinner.”
“OK, I guess you’re going then. See you later.” Brian turns back to the video game as you rise out of the chair and leave the room. Going down the stairs seems really easy this time, but as you get to the bottom your gut is suddenly wrenched by hunger. You hurry the two blocks home, stopping only at the corner store to buy an ice cream sandwich - and find the store is having a two-for-one special on those.

You arrive home, your hunger driving you to walk very quickly, and as you come in through the door your mother says, “We’re having roast turkey tonight, son. I hope you brought your appetite - the store only had big birds.”

“Sure mom,” you reply. “You know me, since I got big, I’m always hungry.”

“Yes, I know. But this bird is so big, I think it will satisfy even you!” She takes the turkey out of the oven, and you can see that it’s enormous - easily 30 pounds! It smells heavenly, though, and with your stomach practically gurgling with hunger, you lay the table. Garlic mashed potatoes - a huge bowl. Stuffing - two pans. A huge bowl of french beans. A huge bowl of squash. A big sweet potato casserole. A shrimp salad. A macaroni salad. A loaf of cranberry bread. A big tureen of gravy. As you lay all these things out, and your mother carves the turkey, an old part of your brain says you could never eat all this. Another, new part argues that yes you can!

You sit down at the table - noticing briefly that your chair is much broader and stronger than you remember - and begin to tuck into the food. Your mother takes a small plate for herself, and eats slowly, talking to you about her work, your cousins, the news, while you shovel the food into your mouth as if you haven’t eaten in weeks. You’re amazed at the urgency you feel in eating - it’s as if your body can’t wait to inhale the mountain of grub before it. Your mother, though, seems to take this as normal - she only pauses to carve more meat off the bird, push another dish towards you, and, amazingly, to refill the mashed potato bowl when you’ve cleaned it out.

You eat, and eat, and eat. The part of your brain that said you couldn’t eat all this is in awe of your gormandizing capacity, while the rest of your brain is enjoying the act of stuffing yourself with food and looking for more. Steadily, the huge mound of food on the table vanishes into your voracious maw. In your old body, you would have felt stuffed in no time, but the gut on this 600 pound version seems to be bottomless - though you notice it swelling out in front of you, your gut doesn’t feel full.

You carry on eating, and eating, and eating, stuffing food into yourself until all that’s left on the table are the bones of the turkey, the stems of some beans, and the tails of some shrimp. Somehow, the whole tableful of food has been transferred into your gut, less only the little plateful your mom ate. She looks up sweetly at you and asks,
